lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

* Runs Duke by scanning and reading the input from the user and executing the Command.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The class for a Parser, which is used to parse the String input into a Command.

* @return The Command resulting from the input
public static Command parseInput(String userInput) throws DukeException {

* Public class for a Ui, which is responsible for printing the output to the user.
* Reads the user input using the Scanner.
* @param message The message to be printed
* Prints a message containing the given size.
* @param size The size to be printed
return String.format("Now you have %d tasks in the list", size);
* Prints the message to be shown to the user after marking a Task.
* @param task The Task that was marked
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:" + task;
* Prints the message to be shown to the user after unmarking a Task.
* @param task The Task that was unmarked
return "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:" + task;
* Prints the message to be shown to the user after deleting a Task from the TaskList.
* @param task The Task that was deleted from the TaskList
public String printDeleteTask(String task, int size) {
return "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + task + "\n" +printSizeOfList(size);
* Prints the message to be shown to the user after adding a Task to the TaskList.
* @param task The Task that was added to the TaskList
public String printAddTask(String task, int size) {
return "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + task + "\n" + printSizeOfList(size);

return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";

* A duke.exception.DukeException is thrown if there is any error related to duke.Duke the chatbot.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidDeletionException is thrown if the user tries to delete a task that doesn't exist, or if the user
* tries to perform a deletion on an empty task list.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeInvalidDeletionException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidDescriptionException is thrown if the user tries to add a task without giving it either a name or
* description, or if no due date or time is given for Events and Deadlines.
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeInvalidDescriptionException is thrown and caught.
* A duke.exception.DukeInvalidInputException is thrown if the user gives an unknown input/command.
* Public constructor for a duke.exception.DukeInvalidInputException which will print the standardized message when thrown and
super("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means D:");
* A duke.exception.DukeMarkException is thrown if the user tries to mark an already marked task, or if they try to un-mark a task
* @param message the message to be printed when a duke.exception.DukeMarkException is thrown and caught.

* @param description The description of the Deadline

* @return the String representation of the Deadline

* @return boolean depending on whether the Task matches the keyword
* Returns the String representation of the Task.
* @return the String representation of the Task
* Public class for a TaskList, which is a list of tasks
* Calculates the size of the TaskList.
* Marks the Task at the given index in the TaskList as done.
* @param index The index of the Task to be marked
* @return The String representation of the marked Task
* Unmarks the Task at the given index in the TaskList.
* @param index The index of the Task to be unmarked
* @return The String representation of the unmarked Task
* Deletes the Task with the given index from the TaskList.
* @param index  The index of the Task to be deleted
* @return The String representation of the deleted Task
* Creates a new ToDo and adds it to the TaskList.
* @param description The description of the ToDo
* @return The String representation of the newly added ToDo
